intro: Strychnos narcondamensis, commonly known as the Himalayan nux vomica, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various birds and mammals. It is also notable for containing toxic alkaloids, similar to those found in other members of the genus Strychnos. Due to its medicinal and toxic properties, it is of interest in both traditional and modern pharmacological research.
